item.title: Memory alignment
item.description: This note was inspired by a work of Samuele Giraudo (LIGM, Université Paris-Est Marne-la-Vallée) http://igm.univ-mlv.fr/~giraudo/Enseignements/ Memory alignment https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Data_structure_alignment Memory alignment of a given data is the way this data is organized in the memory. For instance, an array of n elements of type T is organized as a continuous array of sizeof(T) * n bytes. How does memory alignment work for variables of a structured type? Let’s find out 😊
